<noinclude>{{month|March}}
Events that occurred on 7 March.
==On Earth==
</noinclude>
* '''[[1940]]''' - Voice actor [[Richard O'Callaghan]] is born.
* '''[[1956]]''' - William Galbraith writes [[Letter to William Galbraith|a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien]].
* '''[[2004]]''' - The third day of "[[RingCon|RingCon IV]]" in [[wikipedia:Seattle|Seattle]].

==In Arda==
* {{TA|3019}}:
** [[Faramir]] leads a raid against the [[Haradrim]] in [[Ithilien]].
** He finds [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] and [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] and takes them to [[Henneth Annûn]]. He learns about Frodo carrying [[the One Ring]] but does not try to take it.
** {{Cal Travel-Gandalf3}}
** [[Aragorn]] reaches [[Dunharrow]] at nightfall.
** [[Théoden]] and the [[éoherë]] travel towards [[Dunharrow]].
** Full moon<ref>{{TT|Pool}}</ref>
<noinclude>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wanted this night to have a full moon (seen both by Frodo and Pippin, and the muster of Rohan) and adjusted other dates and routes around it. At first, Tolkien thought that [[Time]] "froze" while the [[Fellowship of the Ring]] stayed in [[Lothlórien]], and in the first drafts of ''[[The Forbidden Pool]]'', Frodo was witnessing the full moon on the night of [[6 February]]. Later Tolkien changed his mind about Lothlórien, pushing ''The Forbidden Pool'' a month later, and also invented the [[Shire Reckoning]]. To accommodate the full moons, and the new calendar, he adjusted the Fellowship's departure from Lothlórien on [[16 February]].<ref>{{HM|RC}}, pp. xlvi, xlvii</ref>

In one of his time-schemes Tolkien used to keep track of his writing, he noted "Total eclipse at 10.30" for the night of 7–8 March, possibly after the 2 March eclipse of [[1942]] (on which year he based the lunar phases). However the eclipse didn't pass into the story.<ref>{{HM|RC}}, pp. xlviii</ref>
